storyInfo: Moira suggests looking for a way to escape. Melanie seeks out Tippi to design the backdrop for her grand finale. While the script's ending is still being written, Greta meets with Lucian, hoping he will become the new leading man. Meanwhile, Steven, struggling with writer's block, hears a knock at his door...

attributes.content: Old Dalton's death and Shelly freezing in the cold storage were no accidents...
attributes.name: Tippi

attributes.content: Now Michael and Marion are dead too, in such a horrible way...
attributes.name: Tippi

attributes.content: Who's behind all this? Why all the murders in the first place? And why are they so... gruesome?
attributes.name: Tippi

attributes.content: I have a feeling that Michael saw this coming.
attributes.name: Moira

attributes.content: He looked a lot more serious than usual when we met the night before the murder.
attributes.name: Moira

attributes.content: He must've figured out the real reason Dalton died, panicked, and decided to get out of here, but...
attributes.name: Moira

attributes.content: Now we'll never know what he was hiding.
attributes.name: Tippi

attributes.content: Maybe this all has to do with that accident five years ago, but what's really worrying me is that...
attributes.name: Tippi

attributes.content: The killer's not even trying to make them look like accidents anymore. What if they're trying to tell us—
attributes.name: Tippi

attributes.content: That until the entire truth is brought to light, nobody is safe.
attributes.name: Tippi

attributes.content: Omigosh, sorry Molly, did my babbling scare you?
attributes.name: Tippi

attributes.content: Don't worry, it doesn't matter if there really is, like, a crazy killer running out there, I'll protect you no matter how many of them there are.
attributes.name: Tippi

attributes.content: Oh, that's not it, Detective Tippi. I was just thinking about... what I can do on my end.
attributes.name: Moira

attributes.content: Huh?
attributes.name: Tippi

attributes.content: Michael's dead now, but that doesn't mean what he wanted me to do doesn't matter anymore.
attributes.name: Moira

attributes.content: The killer might be planning on using the escape landboats Miss Stone mentioned for their next move...
attributes.name: Moira

attributes.content: So if we can figure another way out, or put together something that'll get us to the ground, or even just find an exhaust vent...
attributes.name: Moira

attributes.content: We might be able to get away from this maniac hiding in the shadows and save ourselves during the climax.
attributes.name: Moira

attributes.content: Molly...
attributes.name: Tippi

attributes.content: Tippi, you were the first person to really open up to me after I joined the crew.
attributes.name: Moira

attributes.content: Even though I kept messing up and getting you into trouble, you were always there to stand up for me. When Marion would forget my name, you were always ready to give her a proper reminder.
attributes.name: Moira

attributes.content: You're always looking after me, comforting me, protecting me...
attributes.name: Moira

attributes.content: So this time, I want to protect you too.
attributes.name: Moira

attributes.content: The Liberi gives a gentle hug to her most precious friend in the whole crew.
Once this is all over, we're totally gonna have a movie marathon at your place. Twenty-four hours of non-stop screams, paired with our favorite drinks and fried finballs.
attributes.name: Tippi

attributes.content: I wanna see what the house you grew up in looks like, and meet that sister you're always bragging about.
attributes.name: Tippi

attributes.content: ...Sure.
attributes.name: Moira

attributes.content: I'm terribly sorry to interrupt your little sorority huddle.
attributes.name: Melanie

attributes.content: Oh, wow, Miss Rutherford? What brings you to the prop room? Where's your assistant?
attributes.name: Tippi

attributes.content: Didn't you receive Greta's notice on your terminals? She's already sent out compensation to everyone and officially disbanded the crew.
attributes.name: Melanie

attributes.content: Whether you're scared of the killer, worried about the Catastrophe, or want to stay and finish the shoot, we're all free to do as we please.
attributes.name: Melanie

attributes.content: So naturally it only took a blink of an eye for that spineless assistant of mine to run off god-knows-where.
attributes.name: Melanie

attributes.content: Do as we please?
attributes.name: Moira

attributes.content: Don't tell me Miss Stone—no, none of the crew even care about the real reason all these murders are happening?
attributes.name: Moira

attributes.content: Frankly, my dear, I don't give a damn, and I don't see why you should either. Surely the reasonable thing to do is escape and leave that to the police?
attributes.name: Melanie

attributes.content: Or, as Greta said, you can leave the truth to whoever feels like playing detective.
attributes.name: Melanie

attributes.content: So, why'd you come looking for us, ma'am?
attributes.name: Tippi

attributes.content: I'm only here for you, Tippi, the background painter.
attributes.name: Melanie

attributes.content: Me?
attributes.name: Tippi

attributes.content: I admire Greta's gumption in wanting to film a Catastrophe, and this is a fine opportunity for me as well, but films cannot rely solely on natural phenomena.
attributes.name: Melanie

attributes.content: I know you're more passionate about cinema than most, and you must have heard how important this project is to me.
attributes.name: Melanie

attributes.content: So I implore you, from the bottom of my heart, to put your talent in ambience-building and color-matching to work, and paint the perfect backdrop for my grand finale.
attributes.name: Melanie

attributes.content: Wow...
attributes.name: Tippi

attributes.content: I mean, I'd totally love to, but...
attributes.name: Tippi

attributes.content: Go help her out, Tippi.
attributes.name: Moira

attributes.content: Hey, Molly, what's with the raincoat? Are you really going 'exploring'?
attributes.name: Tippi

attributes.content: Mhm.
attributes.name: Moira

attributes.content: Don't worry, I've been part of the prop team for ages now, and I know my way around the plate. I'll be fine.
attributes.name: Moira

attributes.content: Remember what we were just talking about? This is something I need to do.
attributes.name: Moira

attributes.content: Alright then.
attributes.name: Tippi

attributes.content: Once I'm done helping out with the backdrops, I'll come find you, promise!
attributes.name: Tippi

attributes.content: You may enter, Madam Stone.
attributes.name: Lucian

attributes.content: You know it was me before I even opened the door?
attributes.name: Greta

attributes.content: Yes. I have been waiting for you.
attributes.name: Lucian

attributes.content: Your little investigation the other day forced me to reveal my plan of filming a real Catastrophe to the whole crew.
attributes.name: Greta

attributes.content: The timing couldn't have been worse. Abner and the rest of the crew were already unhappy with me. So I had to make some last-minute decisions. Big decisions.
attributes.name: Greta

attributes.content: If I wanted to, I could sue you for damages incurred by your act of industrial sabotage, Lucian.
attributes.name: Greta

attributes.content: But?
attributes.name: Lucian

attributes.content: But I'm not going to punish my cast just to vent or assert my authority, especially when such actions would only complicate the situation.
attributes.name: Greta

attributes.content: And then, more murders. The killer even stopped hiding their savagery, and everyone's losing their minds, except you. You're the same as ever, cool as a cucumber, watching the crowd from a distance.
attributes.name: Greta

attributes.content: I suppose I can thank this crisis for making it clear that you have other reasons to be here.
attributes.name: Greta

attributes.content: But none of that's important right now. The crew's been disbanded. You can leave, or stay until the date specified in the contract. It's up to you.
attributes.name: Greta

attributes.content: Your part in this is done anyway.
attributes.name: Greta

attributes.content: Hardly.
attributes.name: Lucian

attributes.content: The moment you came to find me, you proved that my part in this is not yet done.
attributes.name: Lucian

attributes.content: ...I can't magic up another Lady Dupont, or bring the three Rockefeller brothers back to life.
attributes.name: Greta

attributes.content: We're running out of both time and manpower. So I need to figure out the best use of our limited resources.
attributes.name: Greta

attributes.content: Lucian, I'd like you to be the lead for the rest of the film.
attributes.name: Greta

attributes.content: In the middle of the night, the clackety-clack of typing echoes through the office.
A despondent Perro curls up in front of his typewriter. He glances at his latest manuscript, and stubs a cigarette out on it.
Ending, ending, ending...
attributes.name: Steven

attributes.content: Lady Dupont needs to die in the ending...
attributes.name: Steven

attributes.content: 'After she elopes with the second Rockefeller, they vanish from high society and live a poetic life out in the countryside.'
attributes.name: Steven

attributes.content: 'But Rockefeller's life of affluence has left too much of a mark on him. He eventually shames Lady Dupont for her empty family name and leaves her. In despair, she slits her own throat...'
attributes.name: Steven

attributes.content: Too realistic...
attributes.name: Steven

attributes.content: And do they really have to be punished after leaving their extravagant lives behind?
attributes.name: Steven

attributes.content: This takes place back when Columbia held wealth as its highest virtue. I'm just trying to recreate it and let the audience judge for themselves!
attributes.name: Steven

attributes.content: The little cigarette burn grows, spreads, and swallows the whole paper up. Steven takes a deep breath and blows away the ashes.
'In the end, Lady Dupont chooses none of the Rockefellers. She had only wanted to escape her false destiny through marriage, but underestimated just how toxic love can be.'
attributes.name: Steven

attributes.content: 'The brothers, unbeknownst to each other, each plot their own revenge, and Lady Dupont is killed by three different schemes at the same time.'
attributes.name: Steven

attributes.content: No, too lowbrow...
attributes.name: Steven

attributes.content: Getting stuck in a quagmire of love even after not choosing anyone makes it sound like it's fate at work, but it's really just slapping in a trope to patch up the gaps.
attributes.name: Steven

attributes.content: The final shot of her body being pulverized into nothing would definitely be shocking, but the setup's just too crude.
attributes.name: Steven

attributes.content: 'The Dupont's family's false claims of being descended from Victorian nobility are finally exposed to the public. No matter how deep the Rockefeller brothers' love for her is, they cannot shield her from punishment.'
attributes.name: Steven

attributes.content: 'The only time in her life that Lady Dupont is treated as true nobility is when the real Dupont family demands the death penalty for her...'
attributes.name: Steven

attributes.content: It's too... neat!
attributes.name: Steven

attributes.content: All tied up with a bow to show off how deep and meaningful it is, but it lacks any of the madness or romance a film called The Death of Lady Dupont should have!
attributes.name: Steven

attributes.content: Tch, out of draft paper. Let me fetch some more from the filing cabinet...
attributes.name: Steven

attributes.content: Whoa!
attributes.name: Steven

attributes.content: Steven slips on a wad of paper he threw to the ground earlier, falling flat on his back.
Only now does he notice that the entire office is filled with discarded drafts. There is nowhere left for him to stand.
He lies down amidst his aborted ideas, covering his face with his hands as he yells in frustration.
Get a Kubricking grip, Steven Quay! You've been messing with the ending for two whole months now, and don't even have a shitty half-baked scene to show for it!
attributes.name: Steven

attributes.content: This is your baby! You wrote every damn line in this story! Don't tell me you don't even know what you want to write?!
attributes.name: Steven

attributes.content: If you need to suffer to make a classic, then this must be a goddamn masterpiece, right?
attributes.name: Steven

attributes.content: You've got the time pressure of the shooting, the shock of hearing about filming a Catastrophe, the fear of some maniac going around killing the crew... You got it all, man! What more could you want?!
attributes.name: Steven

attributes.content: 'God of Inspiration', my ass!
attributes.name: Steven

attributes.content: That was just some stupid excuse to get Greta off your back. Your god ain't coming—you lost his Falking contact details!
attributes.name: Steven

attributes.content: Who's there...?
attributes.name: Steven

attributes.content: ...Well, honestly, I don't care who you are, as long as you can help me figure out this ending.
attributes.name: Steven
